com.xorprogramming.thread

Class UpdaterThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xorprogramming.thread.UpdaterThread

  • public final class UpdaterThread
extends java.lang.Object
    This class regularly updates a given Updatable. An UpdaterThread can be started and terminated repeatedly, and all of its methods are thread-safe. Note that unlike a Thread, UpdaterThread is not made for inheritance.

    Memory consistency is guaranteed for data whose access is confined to an UpdaterThread's update method. However, if data is not confined to the update method, addition synchronization measures must be taken.

    Version:
    3.1.2
    Author:
    Steven Roberts

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float MAX_UPS
      Use this field when setting the UPS to prevent the UpdaterThread from sleeping or yielding, thus achieving maximum UPS.

        Use this field when setting the UPS to prevent the UpdaterThread from sleeping or yielding, thus achieving maximum UPS.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • UpdaterThread

        public UpdaterThread(Updatable u)
        Create a new UpdaterThread object with max ups.
        Parameters:
        u - The object to update
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the Updatable is null
        See Also:
        MAX_UPS

      • UpdaterThread

        public UpdaterThread(Updatable u,
             float targetUPS)
        Create a new UpdaterThread object.
        Parameters:
        u - The object to update
        targetUPS - The number of thread updates every second. It must be a positive number or MAX_UPS, which prevents the UpdaterThread from sleeping or yielding.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the Updatable is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If targetUPS is not a positive number or MAX_UPS
        See Also:
        MAX_UPS

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetUPS

        public void setTargetUPS(float targetUPS)
        Sets the number of UPS that the thread will try to attain.
        Parameters:
        targetUPS - The target UPS or MAX_UPS
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If targetUPS is not a positive number or MAX_UPS

      • getTargetUPS

        public float getTargetUPS()
        Gets the number of UPS that the thread will try to attain.
        Returns:
        the number of UPS that the thread will try to attain

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Starts the thread provided it is not running. Note that if the UpdaterThread is stopping when start is called, the thread starts, but will not run until the thread finishes stopping. This method does not block.
        Returns:
        true if started successfully, false otherwise

      • getState

        public UpdaterThreadState getState()
        Gets the current state of the UpdaterThread
        Returns:
        The current state of the UpdaterThread
        See Also:
        UpdaterThreadState

      • stop

        public boolean stop(boolean join)
        Requests the thread to stop and changes the state to stopping.
        Parameters:
        join - If true, the method will block until the thread is stopped. Otherwise, the method will request termination and immediately return
        Returns:
        true if the request to stop the thread was successful, false otherwise. The request is successful iff the thread is running.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If stop(true) is called within an Updatable's update method becase the thread cannot wait for itself to finish.
